pace verb
(SPEED)
[ T ] to get someone to run a race at a particular speed, for example by running with them pace yourself
C2 to be careful not to do something too quickly, so that you do not get too tired to finish it: No more soup, thank you. I'm pacing myself so that I have room for a dessert.

pace verb
(STEP)
C2 [ I + adv/prep, T ] to walk with regular steps in one direction and then back again, usually because you are worried or nervous: He paced the room nervously. He paced up and down, waiting for the doctor to call.
